title: Border, 6th century
medium:
Medium: warp: S-spun wool; wefts: S-spun linen, S-spun wools
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous wefts (tapestry) with dovetail interlocking and open slits
description:
Fragmentary remains of wide tapestry border containing polychrome figures. Extremely fine, even weaving. Among the figures are a human face with a black turban in three-quarter profile; a fantastical face with rabbit ears; vegetal motifs. The center panel is set off by a blue dovetailed border. Within it, on a blue ground, pale polychrome forms possibly a row of interconnected crosses. At the bottom, a red cross in a natural halo.
In red, pink, blue and black dyed wools on a natural-colored ground.
